trustfund:
TF020925-PARASTATAL REFORM & PRIVATE
            SECTOR DEV.,TF037689-MEXICO - AQUACULTURE
            DEVELOPMENT PROJECT,TF035459-MEXICO - AQUACULTURE
            DEVELOPMENT PROJECT,TF035458-MEXICO - AQUACULTURE
            DEVELOPMENT STUDY,TF022713-PHRD-AQUACULTURE

abstracts.cdata!:
The main objective of the Aquaculture
            Development Project for Mexico was to promote sustainable
            aquaculture development by increasing the productivity of
            the aquaculture sector within a framework of social
            consensus and environmental soundness, thereby contributing
            to economic growth and poverty alleviation in Mexico. The
            project was terminated at the government's request
            after nearly two years of operation from the date of loan
            effectiveness. Disbursements were to concentrate on studies
            aimed at improving the sector regulatory framework. Project
            implementation had encountered insurmountable difficulties,
            deriving basically from: 1) the inability of the Ministry of
            Environment, Natural Resources an Fisheries (SEMARNAP) to
            deliver the planned output, due to the budgetary
            restrictions discussed in the report; and 2) the fact that
            the Ministry of Finance rejected the arrangments set down in
            the Staff Appraisal Report for the Targeted Investment Fund
            and for the AquaMexico fund--this last one on the grounds
            that their execution would have resulted in authorizing the
            new parastatals, which was against the Government of
            Mexico's policy.
